intro: Cicer uludereensis, commonly known as the Uludere pea, is a rare legume species native to Turkey. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its small, pod-like fruits and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it produces edible seeds that are used in local traditional cuisine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
